You need a DVD burner with BurnerMax Tech. An IHAS Ver.B (NOT-C) Look on Amazon or E-bay. After you get one, it doesn't run in TRUNCATED mode because it reads the discs as 8.03 gigs I believe bigger than normal to write all the information down.

but i keep getting a "unable to verify disk" error
Works perfect..Thx ;)
how u got it to work?

The game works fine. 
1.Use verbatim dvd-dl disk
2.Always use a i-Has B Burner (Yes sometimes you can truncate the game but then you will have the unable to verify message because only 97% of the game information was actually burnt to your disc, Because you truncated it. The drive is only $30-$40 just buy it! Ebay is the best cause most already have burnermax software installed.
3.Run through abgx (if all green, then burn at 2.4x)
4. Enjoy the game
@Panagiotis_1992,  Yes, DS3 works with 2.0 truncate mode. I'm on the first disk now,but I'm downloading disk 2, too. The game is awsome ;)
...and always inject 2.0 topology file before you  burn it. Like I sad, the game is awesome!!!
Everything passed when ran through abgx, but it was telling me there is no verified rip of  xex crc in the online database.

Oh and people you do not need an Ihas burner anymore. Check and see if your dvd drive is compatible with a program call burnermax payload, all you do is send the signal and it will tell you if yours is compatible. My Sony was compatible, but I already went out and got an Asus drive and flashed it over to ihas 524b. Remember if you want to still get a ihas burner that you can always crossflash a b chip model drive.

I finally managed to get this to work using BurnerMAX payload Tool V0.15 

Find it from here http://www.ixtreme.net/ixtreme-lt-lite-touch-download/33961-c4e%92s-burnermax-payload-tool-v0-15-a.html

i turned off xbox, then put DS3 again, disk error. 
so i think we have now a new process to start a xgd3 game, and may be the next new coming games? has any body with LT2.0 could start it without playing another game before??
by the way, i was just talking about dvd1. i have not burned dvd2 yet.
